newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Aero wins China 100-seat aircraft deal - Lusa.
newsitem.headline: Aero wins China 100-seat aircraft deal - Lusa.

text.p: China has signed a US$1.7 billion agreement with European aviation consortium Aero International Asia to build a 100-seater passenger aircraft, the Portuguese news agency Lusa reported on Tuesday.
The news emerged at an aviation show in Zhuhai in China near the Portuguese-administered territory of Macau, Lusa said.
Aero International Asia includes British Aerospace.

Zhu Yuli, president of Aviation Industries of China (AVIC) was quoted as saying the AE-100 aircraft was planned to be ready in 2002. AVIC would hold 46 percent of the 20-year venture, Aero 39 percent and Singapore Technologies 15 percent.
Aerospatiale chairman Yves Michot was quoted as saying the aim was to produce at least 1,000 aircraft for sales worldwide.
Under the agreement, the foreign partners will contribute technology and investment to the venture, Lusa said.
Many parts of the planned aircraft would be produced in Europe and Singapore before final assembly in China, it said.
